headline: Netflix Is Looking to Borrow Heavily Again to Fund Warner Bros. Deal
summary: The streaming company once known as “Debtflix,” before it started generating heavy cash flow, is looking to add tens of billions of dollars of debt to finance its planned $72 billion acquisition of most of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. But Netflix Inc. has a stronger balance sheet than it did before the pandemic, which will probably allow the company to boost the price it pays in any bidding war that emerges, while remaining investment grade.  “Netflix’s credit profile really turned around,” said Stephen Flynn, an analyst covering telecom and media debt at Bloomberg Intelligence.

raw.summary: The streaming company once known as “Debtflix,” before it started generating heavy cash flow, is looking to add tens of billions of dollars of debt to finance its planned $72 billion acquisition of most of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. But Netflix Inc. has a stronger balance sheet than it did before the pandemic, which will probably allow the company to boost the price it pays in any bidding war that emerges, while remaining investment grade.  “Netflix’s credit profile really turned around,” said Stephen Flynn, an analyst covering telecom and media debt at Bloomberg Intelligence.

headline: Paramount Could Raise Hostile Bid. Warner Bros. Rises, Netflix Falls.
summary: Paramount could raise its Warner Bros. hostile bid from the current $30 a share. Both stocks rose while Netflix continued to slide.

raw.headline: Paramount Could Raise Hostile Bid. Warner Bros. Rises, Netflix Falls.

headline: A Stock Option Trade for the Warner Bros. Sweepstakes
summary: The bidding war to buy  Warner Bros. Discovery  is creating wild stock-price swings.  The shares have been moving since news surfaced at the end of October that  Netflix  was interested in buying Warner Bros. Netflix said on Friday that it had agreed to pay $27.75 a share for Warner’s studio and streaming assets, which equates to more than $72 billion.  Warner Bros. is up almost 40% from just over $21 before the offer to just under $29.

headline: Will Netflix’s case be strong enough to sway regulators on the WBD deal?
summary: Investing.com -- Warner Bros. Discovery said Friday it has agreed to sell its movie, television and streaming assets to Netflix in a deal valued at $82.7 billion, setting the stage for one of the most sweeping mergers in modern Hollywood history.

headline: 2 Value Stocks to Consider Right Now and 1 We Turn Down
summary: Value investing has created more billionaires than any other strategy, like Warren Buffett, who built his fortune by purchasing wonderful businesses at reasonable prices. But these hidden gems are few and far between - many stocks that appear cheap often stay that way because they face structural issues.
